required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sutureless Closure for Primary Total Anomalous Pulmonary Venous Connection
clinical_study.official_title: Short-term and Mid-term Outcome of Sutureless Closure for Primary Total Anomalous Pulmonary Venous Connection

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the percentage of pulmonary venous stenosis after TAPVC repair with sutureless closure.

detailed_description.textblock: Parents of patients with TAPVC after repairing by sutureless technique will be informed about the study. If parents agree to participant in the study and sign the informed consent, the investigators will collect information of patients and echocardiography results at 1 month, 6 month, 12 month and 18 month after the operation.

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of pulmonary venous stenosis after reparing TAPVC with sutureless technique
primary_outcome.time_frame: The investigators assess the PVS at the time of 12 month after the operation.
primary_outcome.description: The investigators calculate pulmonary venous score (PVS) based on the mean gradient through each pulmonary vein. Then we sum all the score of each pulmonary vein, range from 0 to 12, and classify to 4 levels. Score 0 if the mean gradient is less than 2mmHg, 1 if it is from 2 to 6,9mmHg, 2 if it is from 7 mmHg and above, and 3 if the vein is occluded. The degree of obstruction is classified as follow: none (0 to 1), mild (2 to 3), moderate (4 to 7), and severe (from 8 and above).
Early mortality is defined when patients die within 30 days since the operation

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of pulmonary venous stenosis after reparing TAPVC with sutureless technique
primary_outcome.time_frame: The investigators assess the PVS at the time of 18 month after the operation.
primary_outcome.description: The investigator calculate pulmonary venous score (PVS) based on the mean gradient through each pulmonary vein. Then we sum all the score of each pulmonary vein, range from 0 to 12, and classify to 4 levels. Score 0 if the mean gradient is less than 2mmHg, 1 if it is from 2 to 6,9mmHg, 2 if it is from 7 mmHg and above, and 3 if the vein is occluded. The degree of obstruction is classified as follow: none (0 to 1), mild (2 to 3), moderate (4 to 7), and severe (from 8 and above).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The investigators assess mortality at the time of 18 month after the operation
secondary_outcome.description: Late mortality is defined when patients die beyond 30 day since the operation

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage of pulmonary venous stenosis after reparing TAPVC with sutureless technique
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The investigators assess the PVS at the time of 6 month after the operation.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigator calculate pulmonary venous score (PVS) based on the mean gradient through each pulmonary vein. Then we sum all the score of each pulmonary vein, range from 0 to 12, and classify to 4 levels. Score 0 if the mean gradient is less than 2mmHg, 1 if it is from 2 to 6,9mmHg, 2 if it is from 7 mmHg and above, and 3 if the vein is occluded. The degree of obstruction is classified as follow: none (0 to 1), mild (2 to 3), moderate (4 to 7), and severe (from 8 and above).

study_pop.textblock: All patients with TAPVC operated with sutureless closure and be agreed to joint this study by parents from 01/2019 to 06/2024

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with TAPVC operated with sutureless closure and be agreed to join this study by parents from 01/2019 to 06/2024.
Exclusion Criteria:
- TAPVC operated with sutureless closure have single ventricle, isomerism or heterotaxy, congenital pulmonary venous stenosis.
- TAPVC enrolled to study but cannot the obtain the echocardiography at the time of 1 month, 6 month, 12 month and 18 month.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Medicine and Pharmacy in HCMC
